alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 15 at 3:59PM CDT until June 15 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL GRANT AND SOUTHEASTERN CRAWFORD COUNTIES... At 359 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Boscobel, or 19 miles north of Lancaster, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Grant and southeastern Crawford Counties, including the following locations... Maple Ridge, Plugtown, Boydtown, Highways 60 And 61, Woodman, Easter Rock and County Roads K And T. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southwestern Wisconsin. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
